questions.question_text: Trainees reported that a trainer's innovative use of media greatly enhanced their ability to understand course content. Which of the following audiences is MOST likely to need this information?

discussion.content:
C. The instructional designer.

Trainees reporting that a trainer's innovative use of media has greatly enhanced their ability to understand course content is valuable information for the instructional designer. This feedback can help the instructional designer incorporate innovative use of media into the course design for future training programs.

Option A is not the best answer, as the company that pays to have its employees trained may be interested in knowing about the effectiveness of the training program as a whole, rather than the specific media used by the trainer.

Option B, the person who schedules trainers, may be interested in knowing the effectiveness of trainers in general, but may not be interested in the specific use of media by one trainer.

Option D, other trainers who teach the same course, may find this information interesting, but it may not be critical for their own training programs.

Therefore, the instructional designer is the most likely audience to need this information as it can help in designing effective training programs.

questions.question_text: An instructor is a member of an organization that has recently received a great deal of unfavorable publicity about the actions of many of the organization's members at a recent convention. The instructor has just received the first instructional assignment since the publicized events took place. In this situation, which of the following must the instructor do FIRST to gain the respect of the audience?

discussion.content:
A. Demonstrate acceptable personal conduct.

In this situation, it is important for the instructor to address the unfavorable publicity by demonstrating acceptable personal conduct. This will help to build trust and respect with the audience, and may also help to address any concerns or questions that learners may have about the organization. Once the instructor has demonstrated acceptable personal conduct, they can focus on demonstrating content expertise, flexibility in response to learner needs and interests, and effective questioning techniques.

discussion.content: A. Call on individuals by name to engage them.

The MOST effective action for improving participation during a questioning session is option A: Call on individuals by name to engage them.

Calling on individuals by name is an effective way to engage them and encourage participation. It shows that the instructor is interested in what they have to say and values their input. This technique also ensures that all learners have a chance to participate and can help prevent one or two individuals from dominating the conversation.

Option B (Have each learner take turns asking and answering a question) can be useful for encouraging participation, but it may not be practical for larger groups or for more complex questions.

Option C (Ask for raised hands if they know the correct answer) can be effective, but it may not encourage participation from learners who are less confident or who may not know the correct answer.

Option D (Move closer to the participants in order to actively engage them) can be helpful for creating a more comfortable and interactive learning environment, but it may not necessarily lead to increased participation during questioning sessions.
